content:
I have two cargo configs, one general to use mold, and another project specific one:

~ : cat ~/.cargo/config.toml
[target.x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu]
linker = "clang"
rustflags = ["-C", "link-arg=-fuse-ld=mold"]
~/Programmeren/rust/scuddb/server/.cargo : cat config.toml
[target.x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu]
rustflags = ["--cfg", "tokio_unstable"]

With both of these configs in place, editing a file with nvim+~rls~ rust-analyzer causes cargo build to require a full rebuild for every minor change.

When removing either one of these configs, full rebuilding is no longer necessary.
When using an editor without rust-analyzer to make the minor change, the full rebuild is also no longer necessary.

I wanted to check in here first to see if rust-analyzer is the appropriate project to file an issue to, and if this is expected behaviour.
RLS and rust-analyzer are two completely separate language servers. They don't share any code.
Oh, sorry for the confusion, i'm using rust-analyzer
